select1.label: Arrange MAR next to medication cart cabinet , medication trays and cups
Prepare medication for only one client at a time

Remove ordered medication from cart or shelf. compare label on medication with the MAR and check 5 rights of medication administration .scan bar code if using bar code medication administration .if a discrepancy exists , recheck the clients chart and medication orders
Calculate the correct drug dosage , if necessary

Prepare selected medication -Unit dosage : place packaged medication directly into medicine cup or lay them on tray without unwrapping
-Medication from a multidose bottle: pour tablets or capsules into container lid and transfer them into medicine cup . return any extra tablets to bottle
-Medication from bingo card: snap the bubble containing the correct medication directly over the medication cup. dont touch the medication
-Swallowing difficulty: if client has trouble in swallowing tablets, grind the mortar and pestle or other drugs . mix powder in small amount of pudding or applesauce .don't crush enteric coated tablets or extended release tablets
Unit dose medication , unwrap the medication , and place it in cup before checking the 5 rights of the next medication
Explain the medication purpose to client
Assist the client to sitting position if necessary. give the medication cup and glass of water to the client
If client is unable to hold medication cup , hold the cup to client lips and introduce the medication into his mouth . if a tablet falls on floor , discard and repeat preparation
Stay with client until he swallows all medications . look inside clients mouth if the client is cognitively impaired or has difficulty in swallowing

Dispose of soiled supplies and wash hands
Liquid Medication: remove cap and place on counter top with the inside up.
Take medication directly into client room , do not leave medication unattended
Compare name on MAR with name on clients identification band .if client is not wearing an identification band , ask the client to state his name, scan patient identification bracelet if using BCMA
Complete any pre administration assessment required for the specific medication to be given
Compare medication to MAR and recheck the 5 rights of medication administration , if using
